intro: Pilosella leucopsilon, commonly known as white pearlyweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are hairy and grayish-green, while the flowers are white with yellow centers. Pilosella leucopsilon is often found in disturbed areas and can thrive in poor soil conditions.
